constructor.notice: Tracks Bitcoin starting from a given block. The isTestnet          argument is necessary because the Bitcoin testnet does not          respect the difficulty rules, so we disable block difficulty          checks in order to track it.

getBlockHash(uint256).notice: Returns the Bitcoin block hash at a specific height.

getLatestBlockHeight().notice: Returns the height of the current chain tip.

getLatestBlockTime().notice: Returns the timestamp of the current chain tip.

isTestnet().notice: Whether we're tracking testnet or mainnet Bitcoin.

longestReorg().notice: The longest reorg that this BtcMirror instance has observed.

periodToTarget(uint256).notice: Difficulty targets in each retargeting period.

submit(uint256,bytes).notice: Submits a new Bitcoin chain segment. Must be heavier (not necessarily longer) than the chain rooted at getBlockHash(getLatestBlockHeight()).

documentation.text: @notice Emitted whenever the contract accepts a new heaviest chain.

@notice Emitted only after a difficulty retarget, when the contract
         accepts a new heaviest chain with updated difficulty.
@notice Emitted when we reorg out a portion of the chain.
@notice Difficulty targets in each retargeting period.
@notice The longest reorg that this BtcMirror instance has observed.
@notice Whether we're tracking testnet or mainnet Bitcoin.

@notice Tracks Bitcoin starting from a given block. The isTestnet
          argument is necessary because the Bitcoin testnet does not
          respect the difficulty rules, so we disable block difficulty
          checks in order to track it.
@notice Returns the Bitcoin block hash at a specific height.
@notice Returns the height of the current chain tip.
@notice Returns the timestamp of the current chain tip.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "must submit at least one block"

arguments.value: must submit at least one block

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "must submit at least one block"

documentation.text:
Submits a new Bitcoin chain segment. Must be heavier (not necessarily
 longer) than the chain rooted at getBlockHash(getLatestBlockHeight()).
